prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be a research student. She's camped out to photograph shooting stars.
Character 4
Name: Larry Butz
Description: A friend and former classmate. Also my first client. Often the cause of trouble.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Robert Hammond
Description: The victim in this case. Also, the defense attorney in the DL-6 Incident.
Character 7
Name: Misty Fey
Description: Mia and Maya's mother, and a spirit medium. Disappeared after the DL-6 Incident.
Character 8
Name: Gregory Edgeworth
Description: Victim in the DL-6 Incident, 15 years ago. A defense attorney and Miles's father.
Character 9
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: Veteran prosecutor who hasn't lost a case in his 40-year career. Edgeworth's mentor.
Character 10
Name: Old Caretaker → Yanni Yogi
Description: Caretaker of the boat rental shop in Gourd Lake Park. Thinks he runs a restaurant.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Popper
Description: A classic party noisemaker. Pull the string, it goes "bang". Not very clue-worthy.
Evidence 2
Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: Set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected. Faces the lake.
Evidence 3
Name: Autopsy Report → Robert's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Cause: one bullet shot to the heart. Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Shot from approximately one meter away.
Evidence 4
Name: Lake Photo
Description: Taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. [caption] One person is holding a gun and firing at another person. The fog is so dense that neither of the men's faces can be seen clearly.
Evidence 5
Name: Gourdy Article
Description: Article about a monster sighted at Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Misty Fey's Photo
Description: An old photograph. "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" is written on the back.
Evidence 7
Name: Edgeworth's Request
Description: Document proving Edgeworth's request for an attorney.
Evidence 8
Name: Overhead Map
Description: Overhead map of Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol Bullet
Description: Found in the victim's body. Fired from a 22-caliber pistol. Found in the victim's body. The ballistic markings match the murder weapon's barrel.
Evidence 10
Name: Pistol
Description: The murder weapon. 22-caliber. Fired 3 times. Bears prints from Edgeworth's right hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Lotta's Deposition
Description: "I heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25."
Evidence 12
Name: Missile
Description: A K-9 unit in training. Very cute, with shiny eyes.
Evidence 13
Name: Fishing Pole
Description: Detective Gumshoe's personal fishing pole. Sadly flimsy and of dubious utility.
Evidence 14
Name: Metal Detector
Description: Makes a noise when metallic objects are near. A useful detection device.
Evidence 15
Name: Air Tank
Description: An empty air tank. The valve is open, and a banner of flags is wrapped around it.
Evidence 16
Name: Second Lake Photo
Description: Shows an empty lake. Taken automatically on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.
Evidence 17
Name: Parrot
Description: The erstwhile companion of the boat rental shop caretaker. Answers to the name "Polly".
Evidence 18
Name: DL-6 Case File
Description: File on the DL-6 Incident. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: DL-6 Incident Photo
Description: Photograph of the scene of the murder. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Letter from the Safe
Description: "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth." This note details the murder and set up.
Evidence 21
Name: DL-6 Bullet
Description: Taken from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. Still bears clear ballistic markings.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw it clear as day. The man on the boat was Mr. Edgeworth!
Person: Lotta

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through the provided information carefully.

First, the characters involved include Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Lotta Hart, Larry Butz, Marvin Grossberg, Robert Hammond (the victim), Misty Fey, Gregory Edgeworth (the DL-6 Incident victim and Edgeworth's father), Manfred von Karma, and Yanni Yogi. The evidences and testimonies are related to a murder case involving Robert Hammond, with connections to the DL-6 Incident from 15 years ago.

Looking at the testimonies, there's only one provided here from Lotta Hart: "I saw it clear as day. The man on the boat was Mr. Edgeworth!" So Testimony 0 is from Lotta, identifying Miles Edgeworth as the person on the boat. 

Now, let's look at the evidences. I need to find an evidence that contradicts this testimony. Let me go through each evidence one by one.

Evidence 4 is the Lake Photo, taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. The caption says it shows one person holding a gun and firing at another, but the fog is so dense that their faces can't be seen clearly. If the faces are not visible, then Lotta's testimony claiming she saw Edgeworth's face on the boat might be contradicted by this evidence. However, the testimony doesn't specify when or where she saw him, but the photo is from the time of the crime. If the photo was taken at the time of the murder and shows the shooter but the faces are obscured, then Lotta's claim that she saw Edgeworth's face clearly might be an issue.

Another evidence is the Second Lake Photo (Evidence 16), which shows an empty lake taken on 12/24 at 11:50 PM. That's before midnight, so maybe the timing is different. 

Evidence 20 is a letter from the safe that says "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth," which might suggest someone is framing Edgeworth. If the letter is part of the setup, maybe the real culprit is trying to implicate Edgeworth, so the testimony by Lotta could be part of that setup, but that's more about motive rather than contradiction.

Looking back at Evidence 4's Lake Photo: since the faces are not clear, Lotta's testimony that she saw Edgeworth clearly contradicts that. Because if the photo was taken at the time of the crime and the faces are obscured, then how could Lotta identify Edgeworth's face? Unless she saw him at another time, but the testimony doesn't specify. 

Alternatively, maybe the Overhead Map (Evidence 8) could show something, but without details on its content, hard to say. 

Wait, the Lake Photo (Evidence 4) is taken automatically when a loud noise occurs, and Lotta's camera (Evidence 2) is set to take photos on loud noises facing the lake. So maybe the two photos are related. The Lake Photo (Evidence 4) was taken on 12/25 at 12:15 AM, which is just after midnight. The Second Lake Photo (Evidence 16) is on 12/24 at 11:50 PM, so right before midnight. 

Lotta's testimony says she heard two gunshot sounds just after midnight (Evidence 11, Lotta's Deposition). So the Lake Photo (Evidence 4) was taken at 12:15 AM, which would be after the time she heard the shots. But the photo shows a shooting incident. However, the key point is the identification of Edgeworth. Since the photo's caption says the fog is so dense that faces can't be seen, Lotta's claim of seeing Edgeworth's face clearly contradicts that, unless she saw him at a different time or place. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (Lotta says she saw Edgeworth on the boat) and Evidence 4 (Lake Photo shows faces obscured by fog). Hence, the pair would be evidence 4 and testimony 0.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that contradicts. 

First, I'll start by reviewing all the evidences and testimonies carefully. 

Looking at the evidences:

Evidence 2: Lotta's Camera is set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected and faces the lake. 

Evidence 4: Lake Photo was taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. It shows one person firing at another, but faces are not visible due to fog.

Evidence 11: Lotta's Deposition states she heard two gunshot-like sounds just after midnight on 12/25.

Evidence 16: Second Lake Photo shows an empty lake taken on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.

Now the testimonies from Lotta (Testimony 0 to 4):

Testimony 3 says her camera was set up for a meteor shower. 

Wait, Testimony 3 specifically mentions the camera setup for a meteor shower, but Evidence 2 says the camera is triggered by loud noises. That's a possible contradiction. If the camera was set up for a meteor shower, which usually requires a time-lapse or specific angle, but the camera's auto-shoot is based on sound. But maybe that's not a contradiction yet. 

Looking deeper, Testimony 4 says she heard a noise and used binoculars. The camera would have automatically taken a photo when that noise happened. The Lake Photo (Evidence 4) was taken at 12:15 AM on 12/25, which aligns with the time she heard the noise (just after midnight). 

But the key point is that the camera was set up for a meteor shower (Testimony 3), but the photo taken (Evidence 4) was due to a gunshot sound. If the camera was meant for a meteor shower, why was it set to trigger on sound? That might be conflicting. However, maybe the setup could be both, but that's a stretch.

Another angle: Testimony 4 mentions she heard a noise and looked with binoculars. The camera would have taken the photo automatically. So the photo (Evidence 4) would capture the event she observed. However, the Lake Photo shows two people, but she didn't see their faces because of fog, which matches the testimony about thick mist. That's consistent, not contradictory.

Wait, Evidence 11 says Lotta's Deposition mentions two gunshot sounds. But the Lake Photo (Evidence 4) shows one gunshot instance. If the camera takes a photo each time a loud noise occurs, then two gunshots should produce two photos. But there's only one photo here (Evidence 4) and another (Evidence 16) which is earlier and empty. So maybe the two gunshots would result in two photos, but only one is shown (Evidence 4 at 12:15 AM). The second gunshot might not have a photo, but that's not a direct contradiction yet.

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says the camera was set for a meteor shower, but Evidence 2 says it's set to trigger on loud noises. That's conflicting because the purpose of the setup is different. If she was there for a meteor shower, the camera should be set to time-lapse or triggered by movement, not sound. Therefore, Evidence 2 and Testimony 3 contradict each other.

Wait, the camera's description says it's set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected. So according to Evidence 2, that's its setting. But Testimony 3 says she set it up for a meteor shower. That would mean she might have set it differently, conflicting with the evidence's description. Therefore, the testimony contradicts the evidence about the camera's settings.

Alternatively, maybe she set it both ways, but that's unlikely. The contradiction is between Evidence 2 (camera's trigger is sound) and Testimony 3 (setup for meteor shower, which wouldn't use sound trigger). So the correct pair would be Evidence 2 and Testimony 3.

Wait, but let me check other possibilities. Evidence 11 says she heard two gunshots. Evidence 4 is a photo from one of those? If there were two shots, why only one photo? The camera might have taken multiple, but only one is presented here (Evidence 4 and 16). Evidence 16 is from 11:50 PM and shows an empty lake. Maybe the two gunshots at midnight caused two photos, but only one is shown (Evidence 4 at 12:15 AM). However, the problem states to pick only one pair, so maybe that's another angle. But the most straightforward contradiction is between the camera's purpose (meteor shower vs. sound trigger). 

Yes, Testimony 3 says the camera was set for a meteor shower, but Evidence 2 says it's set to trigger on loud noises. These are conflicting purposes. Therefore, the answer is Evidence 2 and Testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the provided characters, evidences, and testimonies carefully.

First, I'll list out the testimonies given by Lotta Hart. The testimonies are numbered from 0 to 7. Here's a summary of each:

- **Testimony 0**: Lotta says she's not a research student but an investigative photographer.
- **Testimony 1**: She clarifies her profession as an investigative photographer aiming for a monster scoop.
- **Testimony 2**: Her motivation is to capture the monster for a big scoop.
- **Testimony 3**: She was camping by the lake for that purpose.
- **Testimony 4**: She mentions that's all she was hiding (maybe implying no other equipment?).
- **Testimony 5**: When she heard a "bang," she looked out at the lake.
- **Testimony 6**: She kept watching the boat the entire time after hearing the first noise.
- **Testimony 7**: She saw a flash near a man's hand and another gunshot sound.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially those related to Lotta's camera and the photos taken. Evidence 2 is **Lotta's Camera**, which is set to take photos automatically upon loud noises and faces the lake. Evidence 4 is **Lake Photo**, taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM, showing two men with a gun, but faces are unclear due to fog. Evidence 11 is **Lotta's Deposition** stating she heard two gunshot-like sounds after midnight on 12/25.

Wait, Testimony 7 mentions she heard two gunshots (the first "bang" and then another after the flash). However, the Lake Photo (Evidence 4) was taken at 12:15 AM, which aligns with the time mentioned in Testimony 7. But the key point here is about the camera's auto-shooting mechanism.

Looking back at Evidence 2 (Lotta's Camera): it's set to take pictures automatically when a loud noise is detected. If the camera was set to capture on loud noises, then the two gunshots (as per Testimony 7) should have triggered the camera to take two photos. However, Evidence 4 only mentions one photo (taken at 12:15 AM). There's also Evidence 16, which is another photo taken on 12/24 at 11:50 PM, but that's before the incident. 

Wait, the Lake Photo (Evidence 4) was taken on 12/25 at 12:15 AM, which is just after midnight. If there were two gunshots, the camera should have taken two photos. But the evidence only mentions one photo (Evidence 4) and another (Evidence 16) from earlier. This discrepancy suggests that either the camera didn't capture both shots, or the number of shots is different. 

Alternatively, maybe the two gunshots were part of the same trigger? For example, if the first gunshot was the trigger for the first photo, and the second gunshot was part of the same event, but the camera might have a delay or only took one photo. However, Testimony 7 says she heard two gunshots, which would mean two triggers. But the evidence shows only one photo from the time of the murder. That could be a contradiction.

Wait, let me check the exact details again. Evidence 4's description says the photo was taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. Testimony 7 says she heard two gunshots, which would be the two sounds. The camera's setting (Evidence 2) is to take a picture when a loud noise is detected. So each gunshot should trigger a photo. However, only one photo (Evidence 4) exists from that time. The second gunshot would require another photo, but it's not present. 

Alternatively, maybe the first gunshot was the trigger for the photo, and the second was part of the same event captured in the same photo. But Testimony 7 mentions a flash from one of the men's hands after the first noise, implying two separate shots. 

Another angle: Testimony 5 says she heard the first "bang" and looked out. Then Testimony 7 mentions another gunshot after the flash. That's two gunshots. But the camera should have taken two photos. However, the evidence only shows one photo (Evidence 4) at 12:15 AM. The other photo (Evidence 16) is from 11:50 PM, which is before. Thus, the number of photos contradicts the number of gunshots testified by Lotta. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 2 (camera's auto-shoot on loud noises) and Testimony 7 (two gunshots heard). Since the camera should have taken two photos, but only one exists (Evidence 4), there's a discrepancy. However, maybe the two gunshots were part of the same photo? Let me check Evidence 4's description again. It says "One person is holding a gun and firing at another person." That might be a single shot. But the testimony says two shots. 

Alternatively, maybe the first gunshot was the trigger for the photo, and the second was part of the same incident but not captured because the camera's shutter speed was too slow. But that's a stretch. The key point is that the testimony claims two gunshots, but the evidence (camera's photos) only shows one instance. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 11 (Lotta's Deposition) which states she heard two gunshot-like sounds. That's another testimony (Testimony 11?), but in the current setup, the user lists Testimonies from 0 to 7. Wait, the user's input shows Testimonies are numbered 0-7 here. So Testimony 7 is the one mentioning two gunshots? Let me check again. 

Wait the Testimonies listed here are Testimony 0 to 7. Testimony 7 says: "Then I saw a flash, near one of the men's hands, and I heard another gunshot." So that's the second gunshot. The first "bang" was mentioned in Testimony 5. So total two gunshots. 

Evidence 2's camera should have taken two photos, but only one is present (Evidence 4). So the contradiction is between Evidence 2 (camera's function) and Testimony 7 (two gunshots implying two photos, but only one exists). However, the user might be looking for another pair. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 6: "I just watched the boat the whole time." If the camera was set to auto-shoot on noise, then she didn't need to watch; the camera would capture automatically. But that might not be a contradiction because she could be watching while the camera works. 

Another angle: Evidence 2 says the camera faces the lake. Testimony 6 says she was watching the boat the whole time, which is in the lake's direction. Not a contradiction. 

Wait maybe Evidence 4's photo was taken at 12:15 AM, which is when the second gunshot happened? If the first gunshot was at, say, 12:00 AM, then the camera would have taken a photo then, but that's not captured. The only photo is at 12:15, which might be the second shot. But Testimony 7 mentions two shots, so there should be two photos. 

Alternatively, maybe the two gunshots are considered one trigger? Like a double shot, but the camera might have a delay. Not sure. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 7 and Evidence 4. The testimony says two gunshots, but the photo only shows one instance. But the photo's caption says one person firing at another, which could be a single shot. So the testimony's two gunshots vs. evidence's single photo. That's a contradiction. 

Wait, but the evidence's Lake Photo (Evidence 4) is taken when the first gunshot occurred, and the second gunshot's photo might be missing. Thus, the testimony's two gunshots vs. the evidence's single photo. 

So the conflicting pair would be Evidence 4 and Testimony 7. But the user wants evidence and testimony numbers. Evidence 4 is Lake Photo, Testimony 7 is the one mentioning two gunshots. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 2 (camera's auto-shoot on noise) and Testimony 7 (two gunshots, implying two photos, but only one exists). 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 11 (Lotta's Deposition) which says two gunshots. That's a separate testimony? Wait in the current setup, the Testimonies listed here are Testimony 0 to 7. Evidence 11 is a deposition, which is a separate evidence.
